result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey N Pulchinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Huber for employment and other counseling as recommended by the agent.
*Must be served in jail, no electronic monitor, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

*No contact with J.M. except for approval by agent for child placement purposes.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Submit DNA sample.
*Write letter of apology to J.M. to be given to agent for approval before forwarding to victim.
*Attend and complete Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program if there is one available.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Corey N Pulchinski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CM-449 and 16CM-65.

11:55 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.

15CM-449 Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed and read in
16CM-65 Defendant will plead.

Atty Drengler concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 1 15CM-449
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 1 16CM-65

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CM-449: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CM-449: Count 2: Dismissed and read In
16CM-65: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court, joins in the State's recommendation except for the jail recommendation. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM-449: 
Count 1:
Jail sentence 6 Months, Imposed and Stayed
1 Day Credit if revoked
Huber for employment and other counseling as recommended by the agent
Must be served in jail, no electronic monitor if revoked
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
No contact with J. M. except for approval by agent for child placement purposes
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations
Submit DNA Sample
Write a letter of apology to J.M., to be given to agent for approval before forwarding to victim
Attend and complete Domestic Abuse Alternative Program if there is one available

16CM-65:
Jail sentence 30 Days, Consecutive to 15CM-449, Imposed and Stayed
1 Day Credit if revoked
Huber granted for employment and other counseling as recommended by the agent
Entire sentence may be served on electronic monitoring if approved by jail assessment and risk assessment
Probation for 24 Months, concurrent to 15CM-449
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CM-449
Pay Costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 11, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 5, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

*Amended on 12/7/15* No direct or indirect contact with Jennifer Moon or anyone at any residence she is occupying. Any placement of children need to be placed or arranged through a third party, cannot email or text. /s/TTF

Defendant Corey N Pulchinski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:56 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

This is a notice of motion and motion for modification of bond.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court regarding the motion.
Atty Constable addresses the Court, objects to the motion.
Atty Drengler replies.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies the motion.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bond filed by Atty Ryan Drengler

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Corey N Pulchinski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Atty Drengler moves to dismiss Count 1 for reasons stated on the record. 
Court advises Atty Drengler to put the motion in writing, reserves rights to challenge Count 1. 

Defense stands silent. 
Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on defendant's behalf.  Defendant is challenging Count 1 on lack of probable cause.  
Motion to be filed prior to the PTC. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.
No direct or indirect contact with Jennifer Moon or anyone at any residence she is occupying.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct (Domestic), Battery (Domestic).
Court questions Atty Cousins. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions defendant. 
Court advises defendant of right to Public Defender/attorney.

State requests bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  11/09/2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
